intro: Alyxia richardsonii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has simple, opposite, and usually elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are showy, with five petals that range in color from white to pink, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Alyxia richardsonii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in desert conditions.
